item.title: How to Move a Terraform Resource Into a Module Using Moved Block
item.description: Starting from v1.1, Terraform provides a powerful feature known as the moved block. This feature allows you to reorganize your Terraform configuration without causing Terraform to perceive the refactor as a deletion and creation of resources. In this article, we will walk through a few examples of Terraform refactoring using the moved block. Prerequisites Terraform (>=1.1) Move a Resource Into Module First, we will create a sample S3 bucket to reference as a standalone resource.
